page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AROUND DRAYCOTT
page.content: {DRAYCOTT VILLAGE}IS ON THE SOUTHERN SLOPES OF THE {MENDIP HILLS},TWO MILES FROM {CHEDDAR},AND SIX MILES FROM { {WELLS}.MUCH OF THE LAND BEYOND { {DRAYCOTT}IN THE CHEDDAR VALLEY IS VERY FLAT,AND KNOWN IN {SOMERSET}AS{"MOOR"} LAND.UNTIL THE LAND WAS DRAINED IT COULD HAVE BEEN DESCRIBED AS {WET {LANDS},AND SOME PARTS OF IT STILL FLOOD IN WINTER.DEEP DRAINAGE DITCHES KNOWN AS {RHINES}DISECT THE MOORS.FARMERS USE THE MOOR LAND FOR GRASS AND SILAGE ALSO TO KEEP STOCK.AROUND {DRAYCOTT}THE LAND IS FERTILE, AND MANY OF THE INHABITANTS ARE EMPLOYED IN HORTICULTURE,{ {STRAWBERRIES}BEING THE PRINCIPAL CROP. {DRAYCOTT}IS ABOUT TWENTY MILES FROM { {BRISTOL}AND IS BECOMING SOMETHING OF A DORMANTRY VILLAGE,WITH MANY OF ITS NEW INHABITANTS COMMUTING TO URBAN AREAS,AND LIVING IN NEWLY BUILT HOMES.
